resources.string:
Each big project needs a place to thank the people that made it possible. This is the place. So many brilliant people, so many brilliant and creative minds and most of them don't even know they contributed.

First of all, thanks to my brother Fabian for inspiring, creating and discussing every aspect of every detail from the beginning to the end. Without you, this would not have been possible.

Now it\'s my turn (aka Fabian). Usually the most important person is named in the first placed. As this is not the case this time, I would like to thank this person in the second place:

My beloved brother Daniel. Crator of WhatsThat, Mastermind of all programming stuff and of course, brother of all brothers. As I don\'t know anything about programming you had to do everything on your own. With the patience of a saint you searched the solution for any problem for hours, created every line of this code on your own. I would like to thank you from the bottom of my hearth for understanding my confusing thoughts, ideas and sometimes fussy requests and created such a multi-facetted project. I salute you, that you made this amazing app with such patience and stamina!

Meta-Opus Venalo the 364k wants to say thank you, too!

The last thanks applies to the to an unknown user of a video. With each click you could split a circle in four smaller ones which revealed a picture slowly. This created the desire to do this on my own. On that thought the project \"WhatsThat\" was born.

Everything else we would like to mention:

  • This project makes use of DonationsFragment by SufficientlySecure to handle the donations.
  • All those neat popup messages are made possible by SuperToasts from JohnPersano.
  • Some aspects of the mosaic generation rely on JAMA for the math heavy calculations.

Furthermore, we want to say thank you to all those people that were interested in helping during the testing phase. If you want to see your name (or pseudonym) displayed here, contact us! You will either become a new tester or get your deserved credit for already being awesome.

Great testers and/or people with great suggestions:

  • Verena V.

    • Finally, here is a list of all the aspiring artists, who offered their images under free license on the internet whose pictures we used in our app anywhere.

    • For PNG compression the programs OptiPNG, PNGcrush and TinyPNG
    • The websites piqs.de and especially pixabay.com with the authors: Nemo, OpenClips,
      PublicDomainPictures, OpenClipartVectors, ClkFreeVectorImages...
    • The website icons4android.com for the icons in the bundle manager
    • The authors of the images for the experiments are named for each image in the NoPanic dialog.

    The full link to a picture with title and author or detailed backgrounds to an above mentioned point can be obtained by contacting us under whatsthat.contact@gmail.com. Thank you for supporting our app in any way :)!
Brain .. full … cannot .. remember more .. riddles …
Ahhh, what is that?! Twisted and wryly! Complaint!!!11
Image not available?! Check external memory!

This App is a leisure projects of the brothers Daniel and Fabian, who I might proudly call my creators. Daniel, my prof and Fabian my master have installed an anti-advertisement black hole. This will keep pop-ups and trash away. Nevertheless they would appreciate any kind of support:
Write some friendly lines, have a look on the project "https://github.com/DanDits/WhatsThat" or place an anonymous donation!

Stay awesome! :)

string-array.name: contact_mail_body
string-array.item:
Earthlings and copyrights: greater chaos than the univere.
Therefore my creators only use images with a free license. You want to make a picture available for everyone? Answer the following points for the image you already have or still need to attach:

Author's name or pseudonym:
If existing image titel:
Source: (e.g. Website)
Solution words:

This function is only for hyper intelligent and extremely humble beings like, for example, myself.
Should you dare to send a suggestion to my master, be very precise, especially:
What is your idea? How should it look like? How can you interact? How do you find the solution image? A simple drawing might help to give my master an insight into your cluded mind.
If your suggestion is accepted or questions arose, he might get in touch with you.

Congratulations, I thought I crushed most of the beetles in the code :(

When and where did the error happen?
Did it crash or just behave weird?
What was (not) supposed to happen?
What did you do to trigger it?
My creators are happy to receive any positive feedback or suggestions of any kind.\nNegative feedback if by all likelihood going to be sucked into a dark hole. But you might give it a shot.
Oh dear lord of creativity, I almost don\'t dare to say these words but still take the courage and lift my small and minor head and look inside your omniscient eyes and splutter sheepishly… Hello
Holy universe! Someone found it! Call the assassinator, this must not get public!!

If you found a grammar or spelling mistake you might report it right here. Do you like this game but you would prefer to play it in your mother or another language? Unfortunately WiseMind\'s translation program is limited, however if you would like to translate picture solutions or texts, just contact my master. Consider there is no monetary compensation but you can get place in the credits!

resources.string: Get Dr. Drams knowledge for a spot price!

Grow the image pool with fresh cool images.
Grow the image pool with nature pictures and nature objects! For Experts!

Grow the image pool with different kinds of pictures :)!

I want to complain about this riddle and image…TELL US WHAT YOU THINK IS BAD :)
Hint not available for this language.
Information about image and its author
Who took the photo or created the image?
Select an image for the mosaic
Enables you to take hold of more experiments and unlocks achievements.
Challenge your mind with a new puzzle!
Unlock this experiment. Get the others later!
Logo for sharing experiments as images
Potentially the image was compressed to make it smaller. Unfortunately this is done by some sharing apps like WhatsApp or Telegram. Use a lossless way of sharing like email!
Share experiments as images to friends
Allows sharing your current experiment as a simple image file! Unfortunately the image must not be compressed or resized, so you cannot use WhatsApp but need to use something like email or dropbox.
Got WhatsThat? Here is an experiment to solve!
